item.title: Brad Setser on the Massive Shifts Underway in World Trade
item.description: The Fragmentation of World Trade The global economy is becoming more fragmented, with countries trading more with their neighbors and less with distant countries. This fragmentation is being driven by a number of factors, including rising protectionism, the rise of nationalism, and the increasing importance of services trade.
